info.name: easySales V2
info.description: The REST API lets you build apps and other integrations for the easySales app.

item.name: Request Limits
item.description:
easySales API accepts 500 requests per minute per user.

The limits will also be communicated in the HTTP response headers (X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining and X-RateLimit-Reset).

item.name: Errors
item.description:
easySales uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general: Codes in the 2xx range indicate success. Codes in the 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a charge failed, etc.). Codes in the 5xx range indicate an error with easySales's servers.

|Code|Error|Description|
|--- |--- |--- |
|200|OK|Everything worked as expected.|
|400|Bad Request|The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter.|
|401|Unauthorized|No valid Access token provided.|
|403|Forbidden| The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated.|
|404|Not Found|The requested resource doesn't exist.|
|405|Method Not Allowed|A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource|
|422|Unprocessable Entity|Validation error|
|429|Too Many Requests| Indicates the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time|
|500, 502, 503, 504|Server Errors|Something went wrong on easySales end.|

Example error response: 

```
{
    "success": false,
    "message": "The given data was invalid."
}
```

**success** - parameter indicates if the request was successful or not.

**message** - parameter shows the error message.

item.name: Authentication
Redirecting For Authorization
Personal Access Tokens
item.description:
Sometimes, you may want to issue access tokens to yourself without going through the typical authorization code redirect flow.  
You can generate personal access tokens via easySales app's UI.  
  
Personal access token cannot be refreshed and expires in 1 year.

item.name: Website token
item.description:
The website token is used to group products, characateristics, categories and orders.
In order to generate a website token, you must add a new website of API V2 type ({{url}}/websites).
The website token is required for add and save endpoints.

body.raw:
{
	"grant_type": "website",
	"client_id": "{{client_id}}",
	"client_secret": "{{client_secret}}",
	"website_token": "{{website_token}}",
	"scope": "add-products update-products add-categories update-categories add-characteristics update-characteristics add-orders update-orders"
}

request.description: The website grant allows you to obtain an access token using a website_token. This allows you to issue access tokens securely to your first-party clients without requiring your users to go through the entire OAuth2 authorization code redirect flow.

response.name: Website Grant -> Invalid Data
response.body:
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "invalid_request",
    "error_description": "The request is missing a required parameter, includes an invalid parameter value, includes a parameter more than once, or is otherwise malformed.",
    "hint": "Check the `website_token` parameter",
    "message": "The request is missing a required parameter, includes an invalid parameter value, includes a parameter more than once, or is otherwise malformed."
}

response.name: Website Grant -> Success Response

body.raw:
{
	"grant_type": "password",
	"client_id": "{{client_id}}",
	"client_secret": "{{client_secret}}",
	"username": "{{username}}",
    "password": "{{password}}",
	"scope": "add-products update-products add-categories update-categories add-characteristics update-characteristics add-orders update-orders"
}

request.description: The OAuth2 password grant allows your other first-party clients, such as a mobile application, to obtain an access token using an email address / username and password. This allows you to issue access tokens securely to your first-party clients without requiring your users to go through the entire OAuth2 authorization code redirect flow.

response.name: Password Grant -> Success Response

item.name: Authorization Code Grant - Converting Authorization Codes To Access Tokens

body.raw:
{
	"grant_type": "authorization_code",
	"client_id": "{{client_id}}",
	"client_secret": "{{client_secret}}",
	"redirect_uri": "http://example.com/callback",
	"code": "authorization-code",
	"scope": "add-products update-products add-categories update-categories add-characteristics update-characteristics add-orders update-orders"
}

request.description: If the user approves the authorization request, they will be redirected back to the consuming application. The consumer should first verify the state parameter against the value that was stored prior to the redirect. If the state parameter matches the consumer should issue a POST request to your application to request an access token. The request should include the authorization code that was issued by your application when the user approved the authorization request.

item.description:
- In your easysales account, you must create an API client by going to Account -> Settings -> API Settings ([https://easy-sales.com/api-settings](https://easy-sales.com/api-settings))
    
- Using the username and password, website token, or authorization code you can generate an access token.
    
- Make request including this token in the Authorization header with the Bearer authentication scheme.
    

For security reasons the access tokens expire after one year.

easySales uses OAuth 2.0 authorization protocol.

OAuth 2.0 is an authorization protocol that gives an API client limited access to user data on a web server. GitHub, Google, and Facebook APIs notably use it. OAuth relies on authentication scenarios called flows, which allow the resource owner (user) to share the protected content from the resource server without sharing their credentials. For that purpose, an OAuth 2.0 server issues access tokens that the client applications can use to access protected resources on behalf of the resource owner. For more information about OAuth 2.0, see oauth.net and RFC 6749.

**Warning:** Only one token per client can be created, when the new access token is generated the old one is revoked automatically.

### Grants

The flows (also called grant types) are scenarios an API client performs to get an access token from the authorization server. OAuth 2.0 provides several flows suitable for different types of API clients:

**Authorization code** – The most common flow, mostly used for server-side and mobile web applications. This flow is similar to how users sign up into a web application using their Facebook or Google account.

**Resource owner password credentials** – Requires logging in with a username and password.

**Website token** – Requires logging in with a website token.

item.name: Categories

request.description:
Retrieves a list of categories.

The number of items to be shown per page is 50.

response.name: List categories -> Success

request.description:
Categories are created by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the category will be when it is created.


**Category object**:

| Property                  | Type    | Required  | Notes|
| ------------------------- |:-------------:|-----| ----:|
| category_website_id | Numeric | True      | Category id used in your app|
| name                      | String  | True      | Category name|

item.name: Products

request.description:
Retrieves a list of products.

The number of items to be shown per page is 50.

**Filters**:

- page - filter by page
- website - filter by website name
- sku - filter by product sku
- ean - filter by product ean
- status - filter by product status, inactive/active
- created_after - filter by product by created date
    

**Example**:

```
{{url}}/api/v2/products?page=1
{{url}}/api/v2/products?website=MyShop
{{url}}/api/v2/products?sku=02869
{{url}}/api/v2/products?ean=6426485326994
{{url}}/api/v2/products?status=inactive

 ```

request.description:
Products are created by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the product will be when it is created.

**Product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True (Unique) | Product id used in your app |
| name | String | True | Product name |
| brand | String | False | Product brand |
| sku | String | True (Unique) | Stock keeping unit - unique identifier of the product |
| ean | String | False | European Article Number |
| description | String | True | Product description. Can contain basic HTML tags. |
| sale_price | Numeric | True | Seller product sale price including VAT |
| full_price | Numeric | False | Seller product regular price including VAT |
| stock | Numeric | True | Product available quantity |
| weight | Numeric | False | The weight of the product in KG |
| type | simple/complex | True | simple if product doesn't have a parent / complex - if the product is a variation |
| tax_rate | Numeric | True | tax rate, ex: 19 |
| url | String (valid url) | False | Product URL on the seller website. |
| warehouse_location | String | False |  |
| images | Array | False | Array of images urls |
| categories | Array (array of categories ids) | False | Warning! Array of category_website_id's (internal id) |
| characteristics | Array (array of characteristics ids and values) | False | Warning! id is characteristic_website_id (internal id) \[{"id": {{characteristic_website_id }}, "value": "Red"}\] |
| parent_name | String | False | Parent name |
| parent_url | String (valid url) | False | Parent url |
| parent_id | Numeric | False | Parent internal id |
| handling_time | Numeric | False | Handling time (in days)|

request.description:
Products are saved by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the product will be when it is created or updated.

**Product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True (Unique) | Product id used in your app |
| name | String | True | Product name |
| brand | String | False | Product brand |
| sku | String | True (Unique) | Stock keeping unit - unique identifier of the product |
| ean | String | False | European Article Number |
| description | String | True | Product description. Can contain basic HTML tags. |
| sale_price | Numeric | True | Seller product sale price including VAT |
| full_price | Numeric | False | Seller product regular price including VAT |
| stock | Numeric | True | Product available quantity |
| weight | Numeric | False | The weight of the product in KG |
| type | simple/complex | True | simple if product doesn't have a parent / complex - if the product is a variation |
| tax_rate | Numeric | True | tax rate, ex: 19 |
| url | String (valid url) | False | Product URL on the seller website. |
| warehouse_location | String | False |  |
| images | Array | False | Array of images urls |
| categories | Array (array of categories ids) | False | Warning! Array of category_website_id's (internal id) |
| characteristics | Array (array of characteristics ids and values) | False | Warning! id is characteristic_website_id (internal id) \[{"id": {{characteristic_website_id }}, "value": "Red"}\] |
| parent_name | String | False | Parent name |
| parent_url | String (valid url) | False | Parent url |
| parent_id | Numeric | False | Parent internal id |
| handling_time | Numeric | False | Handling time (days) |

request.description:
Products are created by sending HTTP PUT requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the product will be when it is updated.

**Warning!!!** _{{product_id}}_ is easySales internal product id.

**Product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True (Unique) | Product id used in your app |
| name | String | True | Product name |
| brand | String | False | Product brand |
| sku | String | True (Unique) | Stock keeping unit - unique identifier of the product |
| ean | String | False | European Article Number |
| description | String | True | Product description. Can contain basic HTML tags. |
| sale_price | Numeric | True | Seller product sale price including VAT |
| full_price | Numeric | False | Seller product regular price including VAT |
| stock | Numeric | True | Product available quantity |
| weight | Numeric | False | The weight of the product in KG |
| type | simple/complex | True | simple if product doesn't have a parent / complex - if the product is a variation |
| tax_rate | Numeric | True | tax rate, ex: 19 |
| url | String (valid url) | False | Product URL on the seller website. |
| warehouse_location | String | False |  |
| images | Array | False | Array of images urls |
| categories | Array (array of categories ids) | False | Warning! Array of category_website_id's (internal id) |
| characteristics | Array (array of characteristics ids and values) | False | Warning! id is characteristic_website_id (internal id) \[{"id": {{characteristic_website_id }}, "value": "Red"}\] |
| parent_name | String | False | Parent name |
| parent_url | String (valid url) | False | Parent url |
| parent_id | Numeric | False | Parent internal id |
| handling_time | Numeric | False | Handling time (in days)|

The Product resource lets you update and create products in easySales.

**To attach a characteristic or a category to the product, you must first create that category or characteristic using the proper endpoints.**

request.description:
Retrieves a list of orders.

**Pagiantion**

- per_page - specify the number of records to return in one request, specified as an integer from 1 to 100
- page - specify the page of results to return
    

### Available filters

- website -> filter by website name
- marketplace -> filter by marketplace name
- order_display_id -> filter by marketplace or website order ID
- awb_id -> filter by awb ID
- before -> show orders created in the source platform (marketplace/website) before date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- after -> show the orders created in the source platform (marketplace/website) after date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- created_before -> show the orders created in easySales before date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- created_after -> show the orders created in easySales after date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- modified_before -> show the orders updated in easySales before date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- modified_after -> show the orders updated in easySales after date (format: 2020-05-01 00:00:00)
- fulfillment_service_id -> filter by fulfillment service id (see List fulfillment services for id)
- discount_less -> show the orders with discount less then specified value
- discount_more -> show the orders with discount higher then specified value
- discount_equal -> show the orders with discount equal then specified value
- shipping_method -> filter by shipping methods
- delivery_notes -> filter by delivery_notes (can be partial string)
- storno_invoice_number -> filter by storno invoice number
- invoice_number -> filter by invoice number
- invoice_series -> filter by invoice series
- billing_software_id -> filter by billing sotware id
- total_value_more -> show the orders with total value more then specifiend value
- total_value_less -> show the orders with total value less then specified value
- total_value_equal -> show the orders with total_value equal with specified value
- customer_blacklist -> show the orders with value for customer blacklist 0/1
- customer_email -> filter by customer email
- customer_legal_entity -> show the orders with value for customer legal entity 0/1
- customer_name -> filter by customer name
- customer_phone -> filter by customer phone
- original_delivery_status -> filter by original delivery status
- invoice_type -> filter by invoice type (invoice/storno)
- product_ean -> filter by ean of order products
- product_sku -> filter by sku of order products
- shipping_address_city -> show the orders shipped in a specific city
- shipping_address_country -> show the orders shipped in a specific country
- shipping_address_county -> show the orders shipped in a specific county
- shipping_address_street -> show the orders shipped on a specific street
- billing_address_city -> show the orders invoiced in a specific city
- billing_address_country -> show the orders invoiced in a specific country
- billing_address_county -> show the orders invoiced in a specific county
- billing_address_street -> show the orders invoiced on a specific street
    
- process_group_name -> filter by name of a process group
- tags -> filter by tags
- has_awb -> show the orders with/without awb
- has_tags -> filter oders with/without tags (true|false)
    

**Order IDs:**

- **id** - Id of the order in external platform (channel).
- **order_display_id** - user-friendly order id that is commonly used in web interfaces (when the base id is an unreadable UUID for example)
- **internal_id** - easySales internal order id, this id should be used on get and update requests.
    

**The difference between before/after and crated_before/created_after:**

When using before or after the orders are filtered by order_date, this date represents the date on which the order was created in the source platform.  
When using created_before or created_after the orders are filtered by easySales internal creation date, because orders are synchronized with a small delay, order_date and our internal creation time may not be equal.

**Details** property contains marketplace or website order-specific information.

- status -> Filter order by status. Use status id (number) in order to filter orders by status. Filter by multiple statuses using comma separated status id's. Available options:
    

```
0 -> Canceled
1 -> New
2 -> Received
3 -> Completed
4 -> Processing
5 -> Incomplete
6 -> Return

 ```

- payment_mode -> Filter order by payment mode. Use payment mode id (number) in order to filter orders by payment modes. Available options:
    

```
1 -> Online
2 -> Cash on delivery
3 -> Bank transfer
4 -> Unknown

 ```

- delivery_status -> Filter order by delivery status. Use delivery status id (number) in order to filter orders by delivery status. Available options:
    

```
1 -> Ready
2 -> On Route
3 -> Delayed
4 -> Delivered
5 -> Return
6 -> Unknown
7 -> Canceled

 ```

- courier_id -> Filter order by courier. Use courier id (number) in order to filter orders by courier. Available options:
    

```
1 -> Emag
2 -> DPD
3 -> UrgentCargus
4 -> FanCourier
5 -> SameDay
6 -> GLS
8 -> EmagHU
9 -> EmagBG
11 -> TCE
12 -> Bookurier
13 -> Manual
14 -> Innoship
15 -> Elefant
16 -> Speedy
17 -> Econt
18 -> DHL
19 -> Doraly
20 -> DPDHU
21 -> GLSHU
22 -> SameDayHU
23 -> Packeta
24 -> Vivre
25 -> AltexRO
26 -> UPS
27 -> PostaHU
28 -> Foxpost

 ```

- billing_software_id -> Filter order by billing software. Use billing software id (number) in order to filter orders by billing software. Available options:
    

```
1 -> FGO
2 -> SmartBill
3 -> FacturisOnline
4 -> EasySales
5 -> Manual
6 -> Billingo
7 -> Szamlazz
8 -> QuizkBooks

 ```

### Example:

```
{{url}}/api/v2/orders?modified_after=2019-05-01 00:00:00&marketplace=Emag&status=1&delivery_status=1&payment_mode=1

 ```

request.description:
Orders are created by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the order will be when it is created.

**Order object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| order_id | Numeric | True | The number that uniquely identifies an order. |
| invoice_series | String | True | Default invoice series |
| order_date | Numeric | True | Order date (Text in YYYY-mm-dd HH:ii:ss format.) |
| order_total | Numeric | True | Order total value (products values + shipment tax) |
| currency | String | False | 3 letter symbol (ex. EUR, USD, RON) |
| status | String | True | The order processing status. |
| payment_mode | Numeric | True | The order payment method. |
| shipment_tax | Numeric | True if shipment missing | Shipment tax (VAT included) |
| observations | String | False | Order extra details. |
| total_vouchers | Numeric | True | A value describing the voucher discounts. Must be a negative number |
| customer | Object | True | A list with the details about the customer. |
| shipping_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the shipping address. |
| billing_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the billing address. |
| order_products | Array of objects | True | A list of arrays describing the products in the order. |
| shipment | Object | True if shipment_tax missing | Information about shipment value and tax |

**Customer object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | Required if the customer is physical person | The customer's name. |
| company_name | String | Required if the customer is juridical person | The name of the company. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's phone number. |
| email | String | True | The customer's email. |
| fax | String | False | The customer's fax number |
| identification_number | Numeric | False |  |
| legal_entity | 0 - physical person / 1 - juridical person | True | A flag indicating if the customer is physical or juridical entity. |
| bank | String | False | The bank name. |
| iban | String | False | The bank account. |
| vat_id | String | False | The company registration code. |
| registration_number | String | False | The company registration number. |
| vat_payer | company is vat payer: 0 - false / 1 - true | False | A flag indicating if the customer is vat payer. |

**Billing address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The customer's invoice name. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's invoice phone. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's invoice country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's invoice county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's invoice city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's invoice street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's invoice postal code. |

**Shipping address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The name of the contact person that will pick up the parcel. |
| phone | String | True | The phone used by the courier to contact the shipping person. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's shipping country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's shipping county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's shipping city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's shipping street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's shipping postal code. |

**Order product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True | Product id. |
| sku | String | True | Product sku. |

request.description:
Orders are saved by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The object in the request body determines the initial state of the order will be when it is created or updated.

**Order object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| order_id | Numeric | True | The number that uniquely identifies an order. |
| invoice_series | String | True | Default invoice series |
| order_date | Numeric | True | Order date (Text in YYYY-mm-dd HH:ii:ss format.) |
| order_total | Numeric | True | Order total value (products values + shipment tax) |
| currency | String | False | 3 letter symbol (ex. EUR, USD, RON) |
| status | String | True | The order processing status. |
| payment_mode | Numeric | True | The order payment method. |
| shipment_tax | Numeric | True if shipment missing | Shipment tax (VAT included) |
| observations | String | False | Order extra details. |
| delivery_notes | String | False | Delivery extra details. |
| total_vouchers | Numeric | True | A value describing the voucher discounts. Must be a negative number |
| customer | Object | True | A list with the details about the customer. |
| shipping_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the shipping address. |
| billing_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the billing address. |
| order_products | Array of objects | True | A list of arrays describing the products in the order. |
| shipment | Object | True if shipment_tax missing | Information about shipment value and tax |

**Customer object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | Required if the customer is physical person | The customer's name. |
| company_name | String | Required if the customer is juridical person | The name of the company. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's phone number. |
| email | String | True | The customer's email. |
| fax | String | False | The customer's fax number |
| identification_number | Numeric | False |  |
| legal_entity | 0 - physical person / 1 - juridical person | True | A flag indicating if the customer is physical or juridical entity. |
| bank | String | False | The bank name. |
| iban | String | False | The bank account. |
| vat_id | String | False | The company registration code. |
| registration_number | String | False | The company registration number. |
| vat_payer | company is vat payer: 0 - false / 1 - true | False | A flag indicating if the customer is vat payer. |

**Billing address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The customer's invoice name. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's invoice phone. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's invoice country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's invoice county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's invoice city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's invoice street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's invoice postal code. |

**Shipping address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The name of the contact person that will pick up the parcel. |
| phone | String | True | The phone used by the courier to contact the shipping person. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's shipping country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's shipping county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's shipping city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's shipping street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's shipping postal code. |

**Order product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True | Product id. |
| sku | String | True | Product sku. |
| name | String | True | Product name. |
| quantity | Numeric | True | Product quantity. |
| price | Numeric | True | The price without VAT. |
| total | Numeric | True | tax excluded, price \* quantity |
| tax | Numeric | True | Tax rate, ex: 19 |

**Shipment object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT |

**Fee object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| name | String | True | Fee name |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT |

**Voucher object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| name | String | True | Fee name |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT (negative value) |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT (negative value) |

Statuses :

```
    0 => 'Cancelled'
    1 => 'New'
    2 => 'Received
    3 => 'Completed'
    4 => 'Processing'
    5 => 'Incomplete'
    6 => 'Returned'

 ```

Payment Mode :

```
    1 => 'Online'
    2 => 'Cash on Delivery
    3 => 'Bank Transfer'

 ```

request.description:
Orders are updated by sending HTTP PUT requests to the API.

**Warning!!!** *{{internal_order_id}}* is easySales internal order id.

**Order object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| order_id | Numeric | True | The number that uniquely identifies an order. |
| invoice_series | String | True | Default invoice series |
| order_date | Numeric | True | Order date (Text in YYYY-mm-dd HH:ii:ss format.) |
| order_total | Numeric | True | Order total value (products values + shipment tax) |
| status | String | True | The order processing status. |
| payment_mode | Numeric | True | The order payment method. |
| shipment_tax | Numeric | True if shipment missing | Shipment tax (VAT included) |
| observations | String | False | Order extra details. |
| total_vouchers | Numeric | True | A value describing the voucher discounts. Must be a negative number |
| customer | Object | True | A list with the details about the customer. |
| shipping_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the shipping address. |
| billing_address | Object | True | A list with the details about the billing address. |
| order_products | Array of objects | True | A list of arrays describing the products in the order. |
| shipment | Object | True if shipment_tax missing | Information about shipment value and tax |

**Customer object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | Required if the customer is physical person | The customer's name. |
| company_name | String | Required if the customer is juridical person | The name of the company. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's phone number. |
| email | String | True | The customer's email. |
| fax | String | False | The customer's fax number |
| identification_number | Numeric | False |  |
| legal_entity | 0 - physical person / 1 - juridical person | True | A flag indicating if the customer is physical or juridical entity. |
| bank | String | False | The bank name. |
| iban | String | False | The bank account. |
| vat_id | String | False | The company registration code. |
| registration_number | String | False | The company registration number. |
| vat_payer | company is vat payer: 0 - false / 1 - true | False | A flag indicating if the customer is vat payer. |

**Billing address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The customer's invoice name. |
| phone | String | True | The customer's invoice phone. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's invoice country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's invoice county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's invoice city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's invoice street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's invoice postal code. |

**Shipping address object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | True | The name of the contact person that will pick up the parcel. |
| phone | String | True | The phone used by the courier to contact the shipping person. |
| country | String (Country ISO alpha-2 Code) | True | The customer's shipping country. |
| county | String (County ISO Code) | True | The customer's shipping county. |
| city | String | True | The customer's shipping city. |
| street | String | True | The customer's shipping street. |
| postal_code | String | False | The customer's shipping postal code. |

**Order product object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| product_website_id | Numeric | True | Product id. |
| sku | String | True | Product sku. |
| name | String | True | Product name. |
| quantity | Numeric | True | Product quantity. |
| price | Numeric | True | The price without VAT. |
| total | Numeric | True | tax excluded, price * quantity |
| tax | Numeric | True | Tax rate, ex: 19 |

**Shipment object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT |

**Fee object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| name| String| True | Fee name |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT |

**Voucher object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| tax | Numeric | True | VAT Rate, ex. 19 |
| name| String| True | Fee name |
| price_with_tax | Numeric | True if price_without_tax missing | The price with VAT (negative value) |
| price_without_tax | Numeric | True if price_with_tax missing | The price without VAT (negative value)  |

Statuses :

```
    0 => 'Cancelled'
    1 => 'New'
    2 => 'Received
    3 => 'Completed'
    4 => 'Processing'
    5 => 'Incomplete'
    6 => 'Returned'

```

Payment Mode :

```
    1 => 'Online'
    2 => 'Cash on Delivery
    3 => 'Bank Transfer'

```

item.description:
Webhooks provide a way to configure easySales to make requests to your server (or another external service) whenever certain events occur in easySales.  
You can use webhook subscriptions to receive notifications about particular events. After you've subscribed to a webhook, you can let your app execute code immediately after specific events occur easySales.

### List of supported webhook events and slugs

| Event | Slug |
| --- | --- |
| Product created | product-created |
| Product updated | product-updated |
| Product stock updated | product-stock-updated |
| Category created | category-created |
| Category updated | category-updated |
| Characteristic created | characteristic-created |
| Characteristic updated | characteristic-updated |
| Order created | order-created |
| Order updated | order-updated |
| AWB created | awb-created |
| Invoice created | invoice-created |
| Account suspended | account-suspended |
| Account activated | account-activated |
| Products refresh requested | products-refresh-requested |
| Stock refresh requested | stock-refresh-requested |

### How signing requests works

When setting up, it's common to generate, store, and share a secret between your app and easySales. Generating the secret could be done with str_random(), but it's entirely up to you. easySales will use the **secret** to sign a webhook call. easySales will add a header called Signature that will contain a signature the receiving app can use the payload hasn't been tampered with. This is how that signature is calculated:

```
$payloadJson = json_encode($payload); 
$signature = hash_hmac('sha256', $payloadJson, $secret);

```

### Retrying failed webhooks

When your app fails to send a response with a 2xx status code easySales will consider the call as failed. The call will also be considered failed if the remote app doesn't respond within 3 seconds.  
To not hammer the remote app we'll wait some time between each attempt. By default, we wait 10 seconds between the first and second attempt, 100 seconds between the second and the third.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of offers.

The number of items to be shown per page is 50.

**Filters**:

- product_sku - filter by product sku
    
- linked - filter linked/unlinked offers
    
- product_id - filter by product id
    

**Example**:

{{url}}/api/v2/offers/{{marketplace_id}}?linked=false/true - filter linked/unlinked offers

{{url}}/api/v2/offers/{{marketplace_id}}?product_id={{product_id}} - filter by product_id

{{url}}/api/v2/offers/{{marketplace_id}}?product_sku={{product_sku}}- filter by product_sku

request.description:
Retrieves a list of customers.

The number of items to be shown per page is 50.

### Available filters

- name-> filter by customer name
- phone -> filter by customer name
- email -> filter by customer email
- search -> search by name, phone or email

response.name: List customers -> Success
Get Customer -> Success

request.description:
Customers are updated by sending HTTP PATCH requests to the API.

**Customer object**:

| Property | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | False | The customer name. |
| company_name | String | False | The customer company name. |
| phone | Numeric | False | The customer phone. |
| email | String | False | The customer email. |
| fax | String | False | The customer fax. |
| identification_number | String | False | The customer identification number. |
| legal_entity | Boolean | True | The customer legal entity. |
| bank | String | False | The customer bank. |
| iban | String | False | The customer iban. |
| vat_id | String | False | The customer vat_id. |
| registration_number | Numeric | False | The customer registration_number. |
| notes | String | False | The customer notes. |
| blacklist | Boolean | True | Information about blacklist. |
